intro: [WRONG START] Walenia fawcettii, commonly known as the Fawcett's wallenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that are arranged in a dense, circular pattern, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native region.
